Sure, I can recommend a few great local restaurants in the Scottish Borders:

1. The Hoebridge Restaurant - this restaurant in Gattonside, Melrose is known for its modern Scottish cuisine made with local ingredients.

2. The Scottish Cafe and Restaurant - located in the Scottish National Gallery in Edinburgh, this restaurant offers an array of Scottish dishes, including haggis, neeps and tatties, and Cullen Skink soup.

3. Firebrick Brasserie - this family-run restaurant in Lauder, Scottish Borders, offers a mix of French, Scottish and Mediterranean cuisine, and has a great selection of wine and cocktails.

4. The Ship Inn - a traditional village pub in Melrose that serves up classic pub dishes like fish and chips, steak pies, and burgers, with an emphasis on local produce.

5. The Lobster Pot - this seafood restaurant in Eyemouth serves up fresh seafood dishes, including lobster, crab, and scallops, with stunning views of the harbor.

6. The Horseshoe Inn - located in the Eildon Hills, this country hotel has a restaurant that offers a mix of classic Scottish and international cuisine, with an emphasis on local produce.

I hope these recommendations help – there are plenty of great dining options in the Scottish Borders, so you should have no problem finding something to suit your taste!
